Some perspective:CO2 makes up 0.04% of the atmosphere currently (25 times less than 1%).Humans contribute just 3% of that. 3% of 0.04% is 0.0012% (833 times less than 1%).Which means that, if we stopped human carbon emissions completely, it would make 833 times less than 1% of a difference to the atmosphere.Even if we quadrupled our carbon emissions, CO2 would still only make up 0.0436% of the atmosphere (23 times less than 1%).Even if we quadrupled our carbon emissions, only 0.0048% (208 times less than 1%) of the atmosphere would be made up of human carbon emissions. #ClimateCult #NetZero
